discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The OCI Audit service provides detailed logs and records of activities and events performed within your OCI tenancy. It captures information about user actions, API requests, and changes made to resources.

questions.question_text:
You are part of an organization with thousands of users accessing Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). An unknown user action was executed resulting in configuration errors. You are tasked to quickly identify the details of all users who were active in the last six hours along with any REST API calls that were executed.
Which OCI service would you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Object Storage service supports logging for bucket-related events, but not for object-related events https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Audit/Concepts/auditoverview.htm

A. Retention period for Audit Logs can be modified.

D. is also incorrect, modifications in object storage bucket goes to service logs

Selected Answer: A
The retention period for Audit logs in OCI can be changed, and it is not limited to a fixed duration of 365 days.

Selected Answer: D
A. Retention period can't be changed - https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Audit/Tasks/settingretentionperiod.htm
D. Logs from Object Storage bucket goes to Logging Analytics - https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/logging-analytics/doc/collect-logs-your-oci-object-storage-bucket.html

O período de retenção é uma configuração de nível de locação. O valor da configuração do período de retenção afeta todas as regiões e todos os compartimentos. O período de retenção não pode ser alterado.

Selected Answer: D
Changes within buckets are recorded..

A. Retention period for Audit logs is 365 days and it cannot be changed.

In Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), you can configure the retention period for Audit logs, and it is not fixed at 365 days. You can set a custom retention period for your audit logs, depending on your organization's requirements. So, statement A is not correct.

Selected Answer: A
By default, Audit logs are retained for 365 days. You can view the log retention period in the tenancy details page.... The retention period cannot be changed.

https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Audit/Tasks/settingretentionperiod.htm#:~:text=By%20default%2C%20Audit%20logs%20are,domains%2C%20see%20Managing%20the%20Tenancy

comments.content:
D - By default, Audit logs are retained for 365 days. You can view the log retention period in the tenancy details page.
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Audit/Tasks/settingretentionperiod.htm#:~:text=By%20default%2C%20Audit%20logs%20are,domains%2C%20see%20Managing%20the%20Tenancy.

discussion.content: A is the correct answer. by default audit retention period is 90days but can be extended not beyond 1yr (365days)

choices.B: Audit logs are displayed for Compartments.
choices.C: Audit service can record REST API calls executed by a custom client.
choices.D: Changes within the objects stored in an Object Storage bucket are collected as Audit logs.
choices.A: Retention period for Audit logs is 365 days and it cannot be changed.

questions.question_text: Which is NOT a valid statement regarding the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Audit service?
In which TWO ways does Cloud Guard help improve the overall security posture for your tenancy? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Prevents you from creating misconfigurations on your resources in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).
choices.A: Allows you to centrally manage encryption keys.
choices.B: Monitors unauthorized or suspicious user activity.
choices.E: Masks sensitive data and monitors security controls on your Oracle databases.
choices.C: Helps detect misconfigured resources, such as publicly accessible Object Storage buckets, instances, and restricted ports on security lists.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
the correct options are B and C.

choices.D: Resolve or remediate those problems and you should not see Cloud Guard triggering on these resources ever again.
choices.A: Cloud Guard will keep detecting it because a public bucket is a security risk.
choices.C: Fix the base line by configuring Conditional Groups for the detector.
choices.B: Dismiss the problems associated with those resources.

questions.question_text:
A few Object Storage buckets in your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) tenancy should remain public, and yet you do not want the Cloud Guard service to detect these as problems.
In which TWO ways would you address this requirement? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Looks like B and D are correct. 

Any action or setting on a resource that could potentially cause a security problem. Cloud Guard monitors your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure tenancy's network activity to identify and resolve problems. Problems:

 Are created when Cloud Guard discovers a deviation from a detector rule.
 Are defined by the type of detector that creates them: activity or configuration.
 Contain data about the specific type of issue that was found.
 Can be resolved, dismissed, or remediated.

Selected Answer: BC
Dismiss: When you dismiss a problem, you're telling Cloud Guard to ignore this instance of the problem for that resource, and simply ignore it if it happens in the future. 
Creating a conditional group allows for inclusion or exclusion of specific resources from monitoring.

questions.question_text: You want to distribute DNS traffic to different endpoints based on the location of the end user. Which Traffic Management Steering Policy would you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Create a geolocation traffic management policy that distributes DNS traffic to different endpoints based on the location of the end user.
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/TrafficManagement/Tasks/create-tm-policy-geo.htm

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
